Title: Pricing Data Scientist
Description:
¿Tienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podrías asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estarás en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de quién seas o cuál sea tu función, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misión: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor diseñado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el éxito de los demás. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una dirección nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente estés pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Además de grandes compañeros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonomía y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitirá alcanzar el éxito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

🤸🏽‍♂️ Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliación y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una política que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 días al año. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

🏁 La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos rápido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de enseñanza y aprendizaje. Y tendrás sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

🌈 Nuestra fórmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros médicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aquí para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, así que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Nuestra misión es ser el mejor proveedor de seguros de Europa, y nuestras avanzadas capacidades analíticas aplicadas al Pricing son nuestra arma más potente para lograrlo: las decisiones sobre los precios impactan directamente al crecimiento y la sostenibilidad del negocio y garantizan la protección a nuestros clientes en situaciones adversas. Para estar siempre un paso adelante de un mercado que es también rico en datos e información tenemos que ser dinámicos, creativos y precisos. Por eso buscamos profesionales capaces y motivados para nuestro equipo de Data Scientists.

En Concreto, Te Encargarás De Estas Actividades


Analizar cualquier tipo de fuente de datos con el objetivo de crear y mejorar la tecnología predictiva patentada por Prima, análisis como: modelos de clasificación para mejora de variables, realización de modelos de predicción Loss Cost, elasticidad precio de la demanda, probabilidad de renovación, optimización del valor de la cartera.
Liderar la implementación de procesos y metodologías en el motor de precios, ya sean mejoras de los modelos predictivos desarrollados, o nuevas features/lógicas.
Continuo análisis de impactos de los proyectos sobre cualquier acción o decisión tomada o pendiente de decidir.
Liderar el traqueo del dato, monitorizando los principales KPI y posterior toma de decisiones.
Agilizar los procedimientos internos, gracias a sistemas de selección automática de clientes, clasificación de documentos y detección de fraudes.


¿Qué estamos buscando?


Background de negocio y analítico. Buscamos personas con una gran implicación en el negocio, que quieran formar parte no solo del aspecto técnico del rol, sino también tener una visión estratégica en el equipo, además de mostrar habilidades destacadas en el análisis de interpretación del dato. Tan importante es el “qué” como el “por qué”. Además de sentir comodidad proponiendo nuevas metodologías, buscamos proactividad en las alternativas y razonamientos estratégicos que subyacen. La responsabilidad sobre el negocio es clave.
El Data Science de Pricing & Underwriting es cliente y proveedor al mismo tiempo. Somos responsables tanto de las metodologías utilizadas como del impacto de las mismas en el negocio.
Tienes conocimientos y/o experiencia en programación en Python y conoces las principales librerías de análisis de datos y aprendizaje automático (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, XGBoost, etc.).
Mentalidad crítica y curiosa. Miras el mundo que te rodea y siempre te preguntas "¿por qué?". Piensas en cómo mejorar las cosas y buscas que tus ideas se hagan realidad. Además, te rodearán otras cabezas pensantes con gran talento que te enriquecerán y a las que enriquecerás compartiendo vuestros puntos de vista.
Tienes al menos un nivel intermedio-alto de inglés. Prima cada vez es más internacional y buscamos colaborar con otros equipos, por lo que el lenguaje común que utilizamos es el inglés.


Además de los requisitos básicos, evaluaremos con atención estas características:


Tienes experiencia laboral previa en roles similares, con una base en estadística, programación e implementación de algoritmos.
Puedes crear conjuntos de datos utilizando lenguajes de extracción de datos (como MySQL o Redshift).
Puedes analizar y crear modelos en Excel.


Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambición. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusión en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminación por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religión, orientación sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, información genética, embarazo u otras características personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislación nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, únete a nosotros en el fast lane.
Show more
HTML:
¿Tienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podrías asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estarás en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de quién seas o cuál sea tu función, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misión: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor diseñado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el éxito de los demás. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una dirección nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente estés pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Además de grandes compañeros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonomía y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitirá alcanzar el éxito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

🤸🏽‍♂️ Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliación y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una política que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 días al año. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

🏁 La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos rápido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de enseñanza y aprendizaje. Y tendrás sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

🌈 Nuestra fórmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros médicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aquí para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, así que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Nuestra misión es ser el mejor proveedor de seguros de Europa, y nuestras avanzadas capacidades analíticas aplicadas al Pricing son nuestra arma más potente para lograrlo: las decisiones sobre los precios impactan directamente al crecimiento y la sostenibilidad del negocio y garantizan la protección a nuestros clientes en situaciones adversas. Para estar siempre un paso adelante de un mercado que es también rico en datos e información tenemos que ser dinámicos, creativos y precisos. Por eso buscamos profesionales capaces y motivados para nuestro equipo de Data Scientists.

En Concreto, Te Encargarás De Estas Actividades

  • Analizar cualquier tipo de fuente de datos con el objetivo de crear y mejorar la tecnología predictiva patentada por Prima, análisis como: modelos de clasificación para mejora de variables, realización de modelos de predicción Loss Cost, elasticidad precio de la demanda, probabilidad de renovación, optimización del valor de la cartera.
  • Liderar la implementación de procesos y metodologías en el motor de precios, ya sean mejoras de los modelos predictivos desarrollados, o nuevas features/lógicas.
  • Continuo análisis de impactos de los proyectos sobre cualquier acción o decisión tomada o pendiente de decidir.
  • Liderar el traqueo del dato, monitorizando los principales KPI y posterior toma de decisiones.
  • Agilizar los procedimientos internos, gracias a sistemas de selección automática de clientes, clasificación de documentos y detección de fraudes.

¿Qué estamos buscando?

  • Background de negocio y analítico. Buscamos personas con una gran implicación en el negocio, que quieran formar parte no solo del aspecto técnico del rol, sino también tener una visión estratégica en el equipo, además de mostrar habilidades destacadas en el análisis de interpretación del dato. Tan importante es el “qué” como el “por qué”. Además de sentir comodidad proponiendo nuevas metodologías, buscamos proactividad en las alternativas y razonamientos estratégicos que subyacen. La responsabilidad sobre el negocio es clave.
  • El Data Science de Pricing & Underwriting es cliente y proveedor al mismo tiempo. Somos responsables tanto de las metodologías utilizadas como del impacto de las mismas en el negocio.
  • Tienes conocimientos y/o experiencia en programación en Python y conoces las principales librerías de análisis de datos y aprendizaje automático (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, XGBoost, etc.).
  • Mentalidad crítica y curiosa. Miras el mundo que te rodea y siempre te preguntas "¿por qué?". Piensas en cómo mejorar las cosas y buscas que tus ideas se hagan realidad. Además, te rodearán otras cabezas pensantes con gran talento que te enriquecerán y a las que enriquecerás compartiendo vuestros puntos de vista.
  • Tienes al menos un nivel intermedio-alto de inglés. Prima cada vez es más internacional y buscamos colaborar con otros equipos, por lo que el lenguaje común que utilizamos es el inglés.

Además de los requisitos básicos, evaluaremos con atención estas características:

  • Tienes experiencia laboral previa en roles similares, con una base en estadística, programación e implementación de algoritmos.
  • Puedes crear conjuntos de datos utilizando lenguajes de extracción de datos (como MySQL o Redshift).
  • Puedes analizar y crear modelos en Excel.

Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambición. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusión en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminación por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religión, orientación sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, información genética, embarazo u otras características personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislación nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, únete a nosotros en el fast lane.

Title: AI & Effectiveness Executive (Data Scientist)
Description:
El candidato seleccionado formará parte del equipo de AI & Effectiveness en Dentsu participando en diferentes proyectos de análisis de datos, modelización, creación de agentes y elaboración de recomendaciones a nuestros clientes.

Job Description:

La persona que se incorpore tendrá las siguientes funciones:


Creación de agentes y uso de LLMs para el análisis de datos, creación de insights y automatización de procesos.
La elaboración de modelos matemáticos para medir, predecir y simular el efecto de la comunicación en los KPIs de negocio de los anunciantes (modelos de atribución y Marketing Mix Modelling).
Diseño y definición de enfoques o soluciones que resuelvan problemáticas de negocio de clientes del grupo Dentsu a través de tecnologías basadas en algoritmos de IA.
Elaboración y presentación de los resultados y aprendizajes obtenidos de los análisis a los anunciantes para maximizar los resultados de las marcas.
Colaborar en el diseño y desarrollo técnico de nuevos productos y servicios que aporten valor añadido a los anunciantes.
Investigación y aplicación de modelos Machine Learning para la creación de nuevos productos y la realización de proyectos para nuestros clientes.



Requerimientos:


Formación académica deseable: Grado o Máster en Matemáticas, Ingenierías, Física, Estadística u otros grados técnicos relacionados.
Experiencia mínima de 3-5 años como Data Scientist y/o experiencia en proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial o Análisis de Datos. Valorable experiencia en agencias de medios y conocimientos de marketing.
Nivel alto de inglés (relación con clientes internacionales). Comunicación fluida en inglés, tanto en conversación como escrita.
Conocimiento de los lenguajes de programación R y Python, así como buenas prácticas de desarrollo y experiencia en Git.
Conocimientos de BBDD relacionales, PostgreSQL y MySQL además del lenguaje SQL.
Conocimientos y experiencia en al menos una de las grandes plataformas Cloud (Azure, Google Cloud, AWS).
Conocimientos sobre modelos supervisados y no supervisados (Regresión, Clasificación, Procesamiento Lenguaje Natural, Redes Neuronales, Series Temporales, etc.).
Experiencia en el uso de LLMs y la implementación de metodologías RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) y agentes.



Aptitudes y conocimientos valorados positivamente:


Proactividad, capacidad de aprendizaje y aportar en un sector dinámico con muchas oportunidades.
Experiencia en el sector de Marketing y Publicidad. En particular, en medición del impacto publicitario utilizando modelos matemáticos.
Capacidad de análisis y síntesis.
Facilidad para trabajar en equipo.
Agilidad y compromiso.
Orientación al cliente y a la obtención de resultados.
Alta capacidad de comunicación.



Inclusion and Diversity

Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners, and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds, and cultures.

About Dentsu

Taking a people-centered approach to business transformation, we use insights to connect brand, content, commerce and experience, underpinned by modern creativity. As part of Dentsu Group Inc. we are headquartered in Tokyo, Japan and our 65,000 employee-base of dedicated professionals work across four regions (Japan, Americas, EMEA and APAC). Dentsu combines Japanese innovation with a diverse, global perspective to drive client growth and to shape society.

Diversity, equity, and inclusion sits at the heart of our Social Impact strategy – our fully integrated sustainability strategy which includes our ambition to build a fair and more equal society, where everyone is equipped to thrive.

If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.

Location:

Madrid

Brand:

Carat

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Ingeniero/a Inteligencia Artificial (AI Engineer)
Description:
En Grupo NS incorporamos un/a Ingeniero/a de Inteligencia Artificial (AI Engineer) para proyecto remoto o hibrido en Madrid con 3-5 años de experiencia.

Responsabilidades


Liderar un equipo de ingenieros de IA en el diseño, desarrollo y mantenimiento de soluciones basadas en machine learning, deep learning e inteligencia artificial generativa.
Diseñar y optimizar modelos y algoritmos de IA, asegurando su eficiencia, escalabilidad y precisión.
Implementar soluciones de IA generativa para aplicaciones como procesamiento de lenguaje natural (NLP), generación de contenido, personalización de experiencia de usuario, automatización de procesos empresariales, sistemas de recomendación, entre otros.
Supervisar la calidad del código y promover buenas prácticas de desarrollo en el equipo.
Coordinar el despliegue de modelos en entornos de producción, incluyendo el uso de MLOps, AIOps y GenAIOps.
Mantenerse actualizado en tendencias y avances en IA para aplicar las mejores prácticas en los proyectos.
Brindar mentoría y capacitación al equipo para mejorar habilidades técnicas y fomentar un ambiente colaborativo.


Beneficios


Trabajo remoto o híbrido.
Oportunidades de crecimiento profesional y desarrollo de liderazgo.
Entorno de trabajo colaborativo y desafiante.
Formación continua y acceso a recursos educativos.


¡Si cumples con los requisitos y estás interesado en unirte a Grupo NS, postúle ahora y forma parte de nuestro equipo de innovación en Inteligencia Artificial!

Requisitos mínimos

Imprescindible


Título en Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería de Sistemas, Matemáticas, Estadística o un campo relacionado.
3-5 años de experiencia en desarrollo de modelos de IA, machine learning e inteligencia artificial generativa.
Experiencia en lenguajes de programación como Python, R, entre otros.
Conocimiento profundo de frameworks de IA como TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn y modelos generativos como GPT, BERT o Stable Diffusion.
Experiencia en manipulación y procesamiento de datos con herramientas como Pandas, NumPy y SQL.
Experiencia en la gestión y configuración de bases de datos vectoriales.
Familiaridad con arquitecturas de software y despliegue en la nube (AWS, GCP o Azure).
Conocimiento de servicios de IA y ML de hyperscalers (Amazon SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure Machine Learning, entre otros).
Experiencia con MLOps y pipelines de automatización.
Manejo de tecnologías de contenedores como Docker y herramientas de orquestación como Kubernetes.
Experiencia con protocolos de comunicación como REST API o MQTT.
Sólida comprensión de pipelines CI/CD y sistemas de control de versiones.
Habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de equipos técnicos.
Habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipos multidisciplinarios.


Deseable


Experiencia en la integración de IA generativa en aplicaciones empresariales.
Experiencia en metodologías ágiles como Scrum o Kanban.
Publicaciones o contribuciones en la comunidad de IA.
Show more

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Description:
Revvity Signals platforms aim to revolutionize scientific research by providing advanced cloud SaaS data management and data analytics tools to researchers and professionals in the life sciences industry.

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join our Signals Software team. In this role, you will contribute to the development of our cutting-edge cloud analytics SaaS platform, specifically designed for the scientific community. Your work will focus on leading the implementation of new analytics features and data models across various domains and applications, including drug discovery, clinical trials, and chemicals and materials.

If you are looking to join an international team of talented software engineers, data scientists, designers, and product managers, and contribute to delivering amazing, high-impact, customer-focused features, this is a great opportunity.

You Will:


Lead the development of new data analytics features, either within a single project or across multiple projects, based on your prior experience
Collaborate with fellow team members and product owners on priorities, specifications, and feature implementation
Collaborate with data engineers and software architects to define and to ensure architecture will support the business requirements
Create new analytics features in SaaS that leverage AI and machine learning to enable processing of huge amounts of scientific data
Work with analytics cloud services and technologies



Basic Qualifications:


+7 years of professional work experience in data analytics
Exceptional Python programming skills
Experience designing and implementing Machine Learning solutions in the cloud or in hybrid architecture (AWS, Azure, GCP)



Preferred Qualifications:


Msc Degree or Ph
Experience developing and training models
Experience with parallel computing frameworks and technologies (Spark, Dask,...)
Experience in data visualization
Proven ability to provide technical leadership to teams
Experience working within a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Demonstrated ability to work independently and research innovative solutions to challenging technical problems.
Comfortable presenting and demonstrating results in live settings in front of stakeholders and/or customers.
Strong technical writing abilities and analytical skills.
Detail oriented, focused on facts and objectives.
Persistent and structured but flexible when challenged with competing priorities.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
Life science experience a plus

Title: Research Engineer - Electronic and Atomic Protein Modelling (RE1)
Description:
Job Reference

178_25_LS_EAPM_RE1

Position

Research Engineer - Electronic and Atomic Protein Modelling (RE1)

Closing Date

Thursday, 20 March, 2025

Reference: 178_25_LS_EAPM_RE1

Job title: Research Engineer - Electronic and Atomic Protein Modelling (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research. In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer. We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

EAPM is a group focuses on the theoretical modelling of biochemical and biophysical processes placing emphasis both on development of methods and on their application to specific systems. For this, we combine different modeling techniques including: quantum mechanics electronic structure, molecular modeling (Monte Carlo and molecular dynamics techniques), bioinformatic statistical analysis, machine learning, etc. To perform such simulations, we developed an application with a graphical user interface that helps scientists runs their simulations easier and faster.

The Research Engineer will develop and improve our current software for managing, submitting and analyzing simulations.

Key Duties


API Development: Enhance and optimize our Flask-based API for performance, scalability, and new use cases.
Feature Implementation: Collaborate with the team to design and integrate new features in our React application.
Testing: Write and maintain robust unit, integration, and end-to-end tests for both the backend and frontend systems.
Code Review & Documentation: Participate in code reviews and ensure well-documented, maintainable codebases.


Requirements


Education
Bachelor in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics or a related field.
Master in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics or a related field.
Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
Programming skills in Python and JavaScript.
Git and git based code reviews.
Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience
Knowledge in TypeScript is a plus.
Knowledge in Flask or React is a plus.
Knowledge of testing frameworks (e.g., PyTest, React Testing Library) is a plus.
Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD pipelines is a plus.
Fluency in spoken and written English.
Competences
Communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to take initiative and collaborate effectively.
A proactive and thoughtful approach to problem-solving.
High motivation, curiosity, and a commitment to continuous learning.
Team work.

Conditions


The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department
We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures
Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration
Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement
Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
Starting date: asap


Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:


A full CV in English, including contact details.
A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered. Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included. Applications without this document will not be considered.


Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposición"). The recruitment process consists of two phases:


Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position. - 40 points
Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources. In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated. - 60 points. A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.


The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes. For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact recruitment@bsc.es.

For more information, please follow this link.

Deadline

The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

For more information follow this link

Job Reference

178_25_LS_EAPM_RE1

Position

Research Engineer - Electronic and Atomic Protein Modelling (RE1)

Closing Date

Thursday, 20 March, 2025

Reference: 178_25_LS_EAPM_RE1

Job title: Research Engineer - Electronic and Atomic Protein Modelling (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research. In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer. We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

EAPM is a group focuses on the theoretical modelling of biochemical and biophysical processes placing emphasis both on development of methods and on their application to specific systems. For this, we combine different modeling techniques including: quantum mechanics electronic structure, molecular modeling (Monte Carlo and molecular dynamics techniques), bioinformatic statistical analysis, machine learning, etc. To perform such simulations, we developed an application with a graphical user interface that helps scientists runs their simulations easier and faster.

The Research Engineer will develop and improve our current software for managing, submitting and analyzing simulations.

Key Duties

  • API Development: Enhance and optimize our Flask-based API for performance, scalability, and new use cases.
  • Feature Implementation: Collaborate with the team to design and integrate new features in our React application.
  • Testing: Write and maintain robust unit, integration, and end-to-end tests for both the backend and frontend systems.
  • Code Review & Documentation: Participate in code reviews and ensure well-documented, maintainable codebases.

Requirements

  • Education
    • Bachelor in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics or a related field.
    • Master in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics or a related field.
  • Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
    • Programming skills in Python and JavaScript.
    • Git and git based code reviews.
  • Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience
    • Knowledge in TypeScript is a plus.
    • Knowledge in Flask or React is a plus.
    • Knowledge of testing frameworks (e.g., PyTest, React Testing Library) is a plus.
    • Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD pipelines is a plus.
    • Fluency in spoken and written English.
  • Competences
    • Communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to take initiative and collaborate effectively.
    • A proactive and thoughtful approach to problem-solving.
    • High motivation, curiosity, and a commitment to continuous learning.
    • Team work.
Conditions

  • The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department
  • We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures
  • Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration
  • Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement
  • Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
  • Starting date: asap

Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:

  • A full CV in English, including contact details.
  • A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered. Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included. Applications without this document will not be considered.

Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposición"). The recruitment process consists of two phases:

  • Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position. - 40 points
  • Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources. In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated. - 60 points. A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.

The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes. For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact recruitment@bsc.es.

Deadline

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). Title: Junior Backend Engineer
Description:
📍 Location: Barcelona




About Revving

With offices in London and Barcelona, Revving provides a highly innovative embedded finance and working capital solutions to businesses in the digital economy: Adtech, Programmatic, Affiliate, Digital Streaming. Having recently closed its Series A funding round and partnerships agreed with several enterprise customers, Revving is now rapidly scaling and expanding its team to support this.




🚀 Why Join Us?

Be part of a fast-growing startup with a truly unique market proposition. Work in a collaborative environment with exciting challenges and opportunities for growth.




🧳 Flexibility & Hybrid Work:

Tuesdays and Thursdays: Minimum of one half-day in the office.
8-hour workdays.
Access to Aticco co-working spaces (main office: Aticco Bogatell).




🌴 Generous Leave Policies:

25 days of PTO plus all Spanish bank holidays.
Up to 10 days of paid sick leave.




🤑 Perks & Benefits:

Competitive salary and equity options.
A laptop is provided for your work.
Private healthcare insurance (including dental).
An assigned accountant to assist with taxes.




Your Role: Junior Backend Developer

As a Junior Backend Developer, you’ll be an integral part of our team, helping to build and optimize our risk and funding-related web-based product. You’ll have the opportunity to learn from experienced developers while contributing to meaningful projects.




Your Key Responsibilities:
Assist in developing and maintaining solutions using Python with frameworks like Django and FastAPI.
Support the design and implementation of system architecture with guidance from senior developers.
Help integrate third-party APIs into our platform.
Participate in the product discovery process to understand technical requirements and business needs.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code with a focus on unit testing and continuous integration.
Work collaboratively with the team and be open to learning new technologies.
Be proactive in improving the codebase, methodologies, and team processes.
Grow into a role where you contribute to the company’s vision and strategy.




Must-Have Qualifications:
1+ years of experience with Python and frameworks like Django or FastAPI (personal projects, internships, or work experience).
Basic knowledge of tools like Celery, Redis, and Pandas.
Understanding of microservice architectures and RESTful APIs.
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to learn.
Ability to work with existing codebases and debug issues.
Good communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.
Full professional proficiency in English.




Nice-to-Have Skills:
Some exposure to AWS, Docker, and/or Kubernetes.
Basic front-end experience with React (not required but a plus).
Interest in fintech or B2B startups.




Interview Process:
Screening
Take-Home Tech Task + Technical Interview: A simple challenge to showcase your skills + some tech questions during the tech task review.
Product Interview: Talk about how you approach building scalable solutions.




🚀 Ready to grow your career?

Apply now and join us in building something incredible!

Show more

Title: Head of Data Science and AI
Description:
Summary

The Head of Data Science and AI will be responsible for leading the vision and strategy of the Data Science & AI team. This role aims to address unmet medical and process needs and drive innovation in line with the R&D AI strategy. The individual will promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across Novartis teams and supporting functions in Development, ensuring alignment with overall R&D and business goals.

This leader will act as a role model, elevating Data Science and AI as a strategic function. They will help Novartis leverage the latest AI innovations and gain external recognition as a leader in the field. They will possess a broad range of data and digital skills, mentor at the highest level, and serve as an enterprise leader.

Additionally, the Head of Data Science and AI will focus on attracting and retaining top talent, developing and empowering the team to reach their full potential, and forming top-tier external partnerships. They will provide guidance and coaching while maintaining a disciplined approach with clear accountabilities.

About The Role

Major accountabilities:


Design and implement an efficient operating model for elevating the function of Data Science and AI, overall responsible for converting cutting-edge technology and data science advancements into solutions serving strategic objectives of the Novartis Development Organization
Develop and lead a strategy and vision for Data Science & AI that aligns with and influences other functions to establish common goals, scientific questions and business objectives
Build and mentor a high-performing AI team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and transparency
Drive development of Data Science and AI talent, including staffing, designing career pathways and development opportunities, creating exposure and connectivity across the Development organization and beyond.
Drive discovery and implementation of innovative advanced analytics and models/algorithms to generate insights that significantly impact success, cost, and timelines
Developing and implementing the overall strategy for machine learning engineering and infrastructure for current and future AI solutions together with DDIT and other technology-related counterparts
Engage non-technical audiences and influence non-analytical Enterprise Business Leaders to drive major strategic decisions based on analytical inputs and drive data-driven decision-making
Ensure exemplary communication with all stakeholders, including internal associates and Enterprise business leaders
Drive a data-centric and innovative cultural mindset change across NVS to enable data generation, broad use, capability building, and advanced analytics and AI adoption
Lead by example in promoting a collaborative and entrepreneurial culture and mindset. Be an agent for change and engage support for innovative ideas, methods, technologies, partnerships, and solutions, and ensure responsible use of AI technologies
Identify and manage external workforce
Demonstrate internal and external presence that brings recognition of Novartis as a leader and innovator in Data Science and AI
Serve as a member of the Process Innovation and AI Leadership Team


Minimum Requirements


Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field
Minimum 10 years of relevant experience in Data Science with a track record of delivering global solutions at scale in healthcare settings, with a strong preference for experience in the Drug Development space.
In-depth mastery of the external Data Science and AI environment and trends.
A minimum of 5 years leadership experience with a track record of managing multidisciplinary teams and strong mentorship experience with the ability to lead and influence at the highest levels of the organization.
Strong professional network across Academia would be an advantage.
Extensive experience with managing change with organisational savviness and stakeholder engagement


Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Data Scientist Lead
Description:
The Role:




As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be instrumental in driving the company's data-centric projects. You will work closely with the Director of Data Technology and the Data Team, spearheading the creation of advanced predictive models, enhancing bidding strategies, and refining audience targeting. Additionally, you will guide junior team members and play a pivotal role in strategic decision-making to foster innovation within the company.




Requirements:




Demonstrated experience in a Senior or Lead Data science position, ideally within AdTech, MarTech, or a data-heavy environment.
Proficiency in Machine Learning and statistical modeling techniques.
Strong programming abilities in Python and familiarity with ML libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Expertise in SQL for querying and optimizing large datasets.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure); knowledge of AWS S3, Databricks, Delta Lake, Apache Spark, and Redshift is advantageous.
In-depth understanding of big data processing and distributed computing frameworks.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a focus on achieving business impact.
Strong communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in leading and mentoring data scientists, promoting a culture of learning and collaboration.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and working in cross-functional teams.




What we offer:




The chance to work with large-scale datasets in a dynamic AdTech setting.
Exposure to cutting-edge cloud technologies and machine learning frameworks.
Opportunities to lead and contribute to impactful projects.
A supportive and collaborative Agile team environment.
Flexibility for remote working.
Competitive salary, flexible working hours, and private health insurance.

Title: Python Developer (Web scraping)
Description:
Company Description

Job Description

The very rapid development of e-commerce today gives access to thousands of information. These data are difficult to exploit by companies, which then have difficulty choosing the right levers of action and measuring their impact.

This is where NIQ for Digital Commerce comes in! Every day, we collect more than 60 billion pieces of information, process them and use them in innovative monitoring and action tools for professionals in the sector. Our goal: to give our customers and consumers real-time visibility into the market. Today : NIQ for Digital Commerce is a leading start-up in the ‘Retail Analytics’ sector. In full growth, particularly internationally, we are looking for new collaborators to join our fabulous team! A young but experienced, dynamic and complementary team: a resolutely start-up spirit! Real job and career opportunities A friendly atmosphere and a climate of trust that promotes autonomy and challenge!

Responsibilities

Job Description

As a Python Developer within the scraping team, you will be among our talented and passionate team helping us optimize data collection!


Design, implement, and document robust Scrapy spiders, ensuring resilience against future website changes while maintaining existing ones
Conduct comprehensive code review and data validation to maintain the highest standards of code and data quality
Leverage in-depth knowledge of the HTTP protocol, the mechanisms of modern web browsers, and our own internal tools to design sophisticated web crawling solutions that bypass advanced anti-bot countermeasures
Architect and contribute to significant new developments across multiple codebases, providing clear technical documentation and conducting training sessions for relevant teams when necessary


Qualifications

Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field
At least 3 years of professional experience in software engineering
Proficiency in writing production-quality Python code
Familiarity with HTML and JavaScript, with a solid understanding of single-page applications
Experience with RESTful and/or GraphQL APIs
Hands-on experience with major Python web frameworks such as Django, FastAPI, or similar
Knowledge of the scraping framework, Scrapy is a plus
Experience with time series databases, such as InfluxDB, is advantageous
Strong skills in Docker, Git, pandas, regular expressions, Linux, and bash scripting
Proven experience with major cloud providers such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
You are enthusiastic, motivated, autonomous
You like tackling mentally-stimulating software engineering challenges
You are passionate about tech and learning new things


Additional Information


Contract : full-time permanent contract
Enjoy a flexible (hybrid) and rewarding work environment with peer-to-peer recognition platforms.
Recharge and revitalize with help of wellness plans made for you and your family.
Plan your future with financial wellness tools.
Stay relevant and upskill yourself with career development opportunities.


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Job Description

The very rapid development of e-commerce today gives access to thousands of information. These data are difficult to exploit by companies, which then have difficulty choosing the right levers of action and measuring their impact.

This is where NIQ for Digital Commerce comes in! Every day, we collect more than 60 billion pieces of information, process them and use them in innovative monitoring and action tools for professionals in the sector. Our goal: to give our customers and consumers real-time visibility into the market. Today : NIQ for Digital Commerce is a leading start-up in the ‘Retail Analytics’ sector. In full growth, particularly internationally, we are looking for new collaborators to join our fabulous team! A young but experienced, dynamic and complementary team: a resolutely start-up spirit! Real job and career opportunities A friendly atmosphere and a climate of trust that promotes autonomy and challenge!

Responsibilities

  • Experience with RESTful and/or GraphQL APIs
  • Hands-on experience with major Python web frameworks such as Django, FastAPI, or similar
  • Knowledge of the scraping framework, Scrapy is a plus
  • Experience with time series databases, such as InfluxDB, is advantageous
  • Strong skills in Docker, Git, pandas, regular expressions, Linux, and bash scripting
  • Proven experience with major cloud providers such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
  • You are enthusiastic, motivated, autonomous
  • You like tackling mentally-stimulating software engineering challenges
  • You are passionate about tech and learning new things

Additional Information

  • Contract : full-time permanent contract
  • Enjoy a flexible (hybrid) and rewarding work environment with peer-to-peer recognition platforms.
  • Recharge and revitalize with help of wellness plans made for you and your family.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
A Little Bit About Flanks 🚀

Flanks is shaking up the wealth management industry by making it simpler and way more efficient for financial institutions. Our SaaS platform is designed to help banks, family offices, and wealth managers get a full picture of their clients' financial assets—all in one place. 💼💡

Founded in 2019 and based in Barcelona, we’ve brought together a team of passionate wealth management and tech pros, all with a shared goal: to change how wealth management is done. Backed by €9.8 million in investment, we’re growing fast, and we’re not stopping anytime soon! 📈🔥

What We Stand For


People First 🤝 – our team comes first. We want every Flanker to feel at home, engaged, and part of something bigger.
Keep Growing 🌱 – as the company grows, so should you. We’re all about personal and professional development here.
Think Twice, Act Once 🧠💭 – we believe in thoughtful decisions, considering the impact on both our team and our clients before taking action.


If you’re looking for a place where you can grow and make an impact at a fast-paced, exciting fintech startup, this might just be the place for you! 🎯✨

Tech Team

We Power The Ingestion, Processing, And Delivery Of Data For Our Customers. As We Scale, New Challenges Arise—here’s Where You Come In

🚀 Build seamless user interfaces for secure credential storage (UI/UX is key!).

🔒 Handle sensitive financial data with performance, compliance, and traceability in mind.

⚡ Scale our ingestion system to fetch more data, faster.

🧑‍💻 Mentor and grow the team, ensuring alignment and consistency as we expand.

About The Role 💼

This isn’t a senior role, but we expect experience and strong opinions. You’ll have a voice, autonomy, and room to grow, though you won’t be the main driver of most projects.

Skills

We’re not looking for a one-person Tech Team—we want specialists with overlapping skills who complement each other. Whether you’re a broad generalist or a deep specialist, we’d love to hear from you if you excel in:

💻 Front-end (SPAs with JS/TypeScript)

📊 Data modelling & DB performance

☁️ Kubernetes operations

📈 Algorithmic & statistical skills

🔄 ETL workloads

Your daily focus? Coding, collaborating, and delivering impactful solutions—not just merging code but owning it beyond deployment. We don’t follow strict Agile/Waterfall; we do what matters most, when it matters most.

Our tech stack


Python or JS/Typescript on our back-end, using async frameworks and tooling for most parts.
Vue and Nuxt in our front-ends.
Running on GKE
Powered by MongoDB, PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch
Also, Github, Github actions, Redis, RabbitMQ and other usual suspects.


Things we'd love to see on you


You are a nice person: We don’t tolerate bigotry or toxic behavior—just good vibes.
💻 Autonomous coder: You don’t need your work double-checked—you’re on top of it.
You know your way around collaborating with others using standard tooling (git, github PR's, etc).
You are a good communicator who knows how to express problems, solutions and trade-offs.
On the other hand, you know how to read and understand job offers. You can triage what's important and what's not.
🔍 Focused: You know how to read between the lines and prioritize what matters most.
You can work with both legacy and greenfield code
You take ownership of problems.
💼 Wealth knowledge: A little expertise in investments, currencies, crypto, or wealth management is a plus.
You live in Barcelona City and/or close enough to come to the office a few times a month. Living in Spain is a mandatory and non-negotiable requirement.
You’re fluent in English and Spanish.
💼 Experience matters: This is not an entry-level role.
Tech savvy: Familiar with our tech stack—or similar ones.


You don’t have to check every box, but the more you fit this, the more likely we’ll be excited to hear from you! 🚀

What We Offer 🎁

We offer what we think is fair compensation (from 36K to 60K € per year for this role). We're not on the very top of the market, but our intention is to increase compensation as you grow with the company. You will not be left behind. We believe this is a really nice time to join the project as we'll experience some serious growth and changes during this year.

This is a full-time, permanent contract. A non-exhaustive list of perks includes:


A full-time, permanent contract. 📃
A cool office between Sants Estació and Plaça Espanya with stunning views of Barcelona. 🏙️✨
Flexible working hours and hybrid work options. ⏰
Paid day off on your birthday. 🎂🎉
Weekly fresh fruit, coffee, and tea on tap. 🍎🍵
Friday happy hours after our all-hands meetings (totally optional, of course!). 🍻🥳
Team-building events to bond and have fun. 🎈🤝
Health insurance and flexible compensation with Alan. 🏥💸
A digital canteen, thanks to Nora Real Food, subsidised at 50%. 🍽️😋
A yearly training budget to keep growing. 📚📈


Note that for this role we can’t offer a relocation package and/or working visa.

The hiring process ⚙️


Send us your CV, cover letter, etc. 📧
You’ll have a chat with our Head of People, Mireia Barón. 💬
A meeting with our Tech Team.
Technical Test – We’ll send you a take-home test to complete to assess your skills. 📋
Final Interview – Discuss your technical approach with our CTO, Diego Kuperman. 🧠⚡
Any extra meetings you (or we) might need to iron out any questions. 🤔
We send you an offer! 💌


We aim to keep things moving fast—ideally wrapping things up in one to four weeks. ⏳💨

If this sounds like a good fit for you, we’d love to hear from you. Don’t hesitate to send us your CV and/or cover letter. ✉️🤗

At Flanks, we believe in fostering diversity and inclusion across everything we do. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome all applications regardless of race, religion, gender, age, or disability status. 🌈💼
Show more

Title: Junior Software Developer
Description:
Sobre nosotros




Konozca es una Consultora Tecnológica Estratégica partner de Salesforce.

Especializados en ayudar a nuestros clientes, desde Startups y PYMES a grandes

corporaciones, a mejorar sus procesos de negocio gracias a Salesforce.




Contamos con una trayectoria exitosa reflejada en los más de 1500 proyectos

implantados con éxito enfocados a clientes de todo el mundo, además hemos sido

premiados como Partners Awards de Salesforce por nuestro trabajo basado en la

fiabilidad, rapidez y seguridad.




En Konozca evolucionamos y crecemos basándonos en nuestros cuatro pilares

fundamentales: la innovación, confianza, crecimiento e igualdad. Crecimiento basado en

las personas de las que sabemos que es nuestro pilar fundamental y por ello realizamos

un gran esfuerzo en fidelizar a nuestros profesionales para que en todo momento

sientan que están en su Compañía.




Descripción del puesto




Buscamos un desarrollador que quiera dar sus primeros pasos en el ecosistema

Salesforce, con ganas de aprender y crecer en un entorno dinámico. Formarás parte de

un equipo que desarrolla soluciones personalizadas en Salesforce, colaborando con

consultores, desarrolladores senior, arquitectos, a la vez que trabajando en diferentes

nubes e integraciones de Salesforce.




Responsabilidades




➢ Desarrollo e implantación de mejoras y soluciones técnicas basadas en

Salesforce, con Apex, Lightning Web Components y Flows.

➢ Realización de tareas asignadas por el gestor de equipo.

➢ Realización de configuración, pruebas y despliegues de soluciones Salesforce.

➢ Colaboración con el resto del equipo para asegurar la implementación de alta

calidad.

➢ Solucionar problemas para mejorar el rendimiento del sistema.

➢ Documentar soluciones técnicas y seguir las mejores prácticas de desarrollo.

➢ Mantenerse al día con las nuevas funcionalidades de Salesforce.

➢ Uso de las herramientas de control de versiones definidas.

➢ Nivel de inglés técnico alto.




Qué ofrecemos




➢ En Konozca te ofrecemos formar parte de un equipo profesional, joven, dinámico

y eficaz

➢ Salario de mercado acorde con la experiencia y formación

➢ Formación y mentoría en Salesforce desde cero.

➢ Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos reales desde el inicio.

➢ Un equipo colaborativo y dinámico.

➢ Opciones de trabajo híbrido.

➢ Plan de formación personalizado

➢ Plan de Certificaciones Salesforce




Requisitos




➢ Conocimiento profundo de lenguajes de programación orientada a objetos, en

específico Java o C++.

➢ Grado universitario de Ingeniería Informática o Ingeniería en Sistemas de

Telecomunicaciones.

➢ Lenguajes web (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) altamente valorables.




➢ Conocimiento profundo de bases de datos relacionales.

➢ SQL.

➢ Experiencia en herramientas de control de versiones, como Git.

➢ Conocimiento de entornos de desarrollo integrados o editores de código, como

Visual Studio Code.

➢ Conocimiento de estructuras de datos y algoritmos básicos.

➢ Conocimiento de protocolos HTTP/HTTPS y arquitectura cliente-servidor.

➢ Familiaridad con principios de testing y escritura de tests unitarios.

➢ Habilidades de comunicación extensas, tanto escritas como verbales.

➢ Nivel básico de conocimientos de seguridad.




Cualidades




➢ Ser capaz de mantener una perspectiva crítica y orientada a la excelencia en

nuestros proyectos.

➢ Ser una persona acostumbrada a gestionar relaciones con clientes, ser

comunicativo y contar con un espíritu de equipo para una mayor armonía y

profesionalidad

➢ Ganas de aprender y crecer en el mundo Salesforce.

➢ Interés por el desarrollo en la nube y los CRM.

➢ Mostrar ganas de aprender y afrontar nuevos retos dentro de la compañía.

➢ Ser una persona apasionada por la tecnología con ganas de trabajar en una

empresa líder en el sector.

Show more

Title: Software Engineer - fresh graduate
Description:
Job Description

We’re looking for a Software Engineer to join one of our Foundation Architecture development teams, concretely the Ask Oracle Search one. Focusing on our Search engine and functionality, you will strengthen our ability to provide our customers with the information they are looking for, at the time they need it.

Are you going to finish the University this academic year, 2024/2025?

Starting day June 1st, 2025 onward!

EU visa and work permission mandatory!

Collaborating with other engineers, product managers, and designers in our international cross-location team you’ll be dealing with challenges like creating an exceptional UI experience to our customers that allow them to find the more relevant results for the task they intend to do at any given time.

What You'll Do

You will be part of one of our agile teams in Foundation Architecture and your main task will be the development and delivery of the Search features. You will participate in all the tasks involved in the agile process.

Constantly spending time-solving challenges, learning and processing new information, and iterating over your ideas. It's a fun and challenging process that will help you grow in the role as you add value to the company and become an expert in different areas.

You will fit perfectly if you share these values:


Open mind, honesty, and transparency for discussion and team collaboration
Pride in your work and a desire to delight the customer should motivate you to take initiative, take responsibility, and take ownership of your projects.
Excellent communicator in both technical and non-technical contexts
Strong drive for excellent software design and clean code principles



Your Qualifications & Skills


B.S or Master's in computer engineering or relevant experience in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
Experience in Java or C#, more importantly, experience with OOP and design patterns
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Passion for solving problems and focusing on simplicity
Team player and people focused
Ability to connect pieces of information and explain them in non-technical language
Ability to break down problems into simple units of work
Work permit for Spain is required for this role.



Nice to have


Experience in modern front-end development (Ideally Micro frontend / React or similar)
Experience working in an Agile/SCRUM development team
Experience developing in TypeScript or JavaScript
Experience with ERP systems development



At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

Job Description

We’re looking for a Software Engineer to join one of our Foundation Architecture development teams, concretely the Ask Oracle Search one. Focusing on our Search engine and functionality, you will strengthen our ability to provide our customers with the information they are looking for, at the time they need it.

Are you going to finish the University this academic year, 2024/2025?

Starting day June 1st, 2025 onward!

EU visa and work permission mandatory!

Collaborating with other engineers, product managers, and designers in our international cross-location team you’ll be dealing with challenges like creating an exceptional UI experience to our customers that allow them to find the more relevant results for the task they intend to do at any given time.

What You'll Do

You will be part of one of our agile teams in Foundation Architecture and your main task will be the development and delivery of the Search features. You will participate in all the tasks involved in the agile process.

Constantly spending time-solving challenges, learning and processing new information, and iterating over your ideas. It's a fun and challenging process that will help you grow in the role as you add value to the company and become an expert in different areas.

Title: Programador/a (sector industrial - Barcelona centro)
Description:
Desde Hays Technology estamos buscando un/a programador/a MES para compañía de ingeniería de sistemas de automatización y control industrial (4.0), con más de 40 años en el mercado y filiales en Inglaterra, Malasia y Australia dentro de sus oficinas de Barcelona centro.




La empresa, de origen Catalán y con oficinas en España, UK, Malasia y Australia, tiene más de 40 años de experiencia diseñando, construyendo e instalando sistemas de ensayo y control para procesos de fabricación y producción dentro de diferentes industrias (Agua, Química, Automoción & Motores, Farmacéutica, Alimentación & Bebidas, Papel, Energía, Metal & Minería , ...).




Te integrarás dentro del departamento IT y en dependencia directa del líder de desarrollo te encargarás de:




Desarrollo de aplicaciones basadas en Ignition, Siemens XHQ, AVEVA MES, AVEVA PI, ...
Colaborar en el análisis de requerimientos y el diseño de las aplicaciones.
Pruebas de integración, puesta en marcha y documentación.
Puesta al día continua en herramientas y tecnología. Reciclaje constante.
Generar código bien diseñado, comprobable y eficiente utilizado buenas prácticas.
Colaborar con los equipos implicados.




Requisitos:




Titulación técnica.
2 o más años de experiencia en un puesto similar.
Conocimiento amplio en Bases de datos (preferentemente SQL Server)
Conocimientos en algún lenguaje de programación orientada a objetos (C++, .NET, C#, Java, Phyton).
Capacidad resolutiva y proactividad, habilidad intelectiva para la obtención y análisis de información, planificación y organización, toma de decisiones e iniciativa para afrontar imprevistos y trabajo en equipo.




Valorable:




Experiencia y/o interés por el sector industrial y la industria 4.0.
Conocimientos de algún sistema SCADA o HMI.
Conocimientos de alguna de las soluciones AVEVA/Wonderware, OSISoft PI o Ignition.




La empresa ofrece un atractivo paquete retributivo que incluye:




Salario acorde a la experiencia aportada.
Contratación indefinida (cliente final).
Formación en tecnologías contemporáneas y proyectos internacionales.
Jornada híbrida y viernes intensivos.
Oficinas en Barcelona centro (Eixample).
Plan de carrera personalizado.
Posibilidad real de crecimiento.




Si quieres trabajar con las últimas tecnologías del mercado, tienes ganas de aprender y desarrollarte ¡No dudes en aplicar!

Title: Senior/Staff Applied Scientist
Description:
✨ About Us ✨

Photoroom was launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our mission is clear: to create the best visuals for your commerce.

Photoroom puts the power of great images into more people's hands through our powerful and innovative features, from our best-in-the-world background remover to our generative AI model and tools: AI Images, AI Backgrounds and Shadows, AI Expand, and many more.

Processing over 5 billion images a year and downloaded over 200 million times, Photoroom is now the world's #1 AI photo-editing app, available across mobile, web, and via an API in over 180 countries.

We are at an exciting stage of our journey. Having successfully raised our Series B, we aim at sustaining 80% YoY growth.

Photoroom is a profitable, remote-friendly company headquartered in Paris with a global team of over 80 world-class deep learning, product, and marketing experts with backgrounds at the world's best companies. We are a diverse team of entrepreneurs building for entrepreneurs.

TL; DR 🤓

Photoroom is looking for a talented Senior/Staff Applied Scientist. You will work on several ML solutions, starting from the requirements, literature, all the way to a product. You will own most of this process, be trusted and have your say on data acquisition, optional labelling, overall strategy and follow-ups. Your work will serve millions of users, be useful and be remarked.

💰 Competitive salary + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 We are flexible: you can work from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ) and come to our office once a month (fully reimbursed) or more often. This ensures effective collaboration and supports our commitment to reducing our carbon footprint.

✈️ We offer substantial support for relocation (10k€ signing bonus), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure.

💻 Technology - new MacBook Pro, monitor, keyboard, etc.

🏖️ Socials - Quarterly company retreats, weekly Happy Hour & Game Time

🇬🇧 PhotoRoom is an international team and we work in English. We offer language lessons for those who need them (English & French).

✨ About The Role ✨


You'll be the ninth engineer in the ML team, working alongside great talent from various backgrounds.
You will have full ownership of your ML work streams when applicable, or work with teammates on big topics. You have expertise and ownership; you have a say in how that goes.
You will master the whole pipeline, from training models to putting them into production and monitoring their performance.
You will work on new features, new applications, and some 0→1 solutions.
You will get fast feedback from our users and will iterate quickly. You will follow the usage of the product and make decisions based on that.
You will work within a small multicultural team composed of ~75 passionate, friendly & committed folks.


✨ About You ✨


You have 3+ years of experience with PyTorch, Tensorflow or Jax, and are willing to start or keep working with PyTorch.
You have a deep experience with diffusion models, for image creation or edition**.** You’ve trained diffusion models from scratch, or practiced deep surgery beyond their original pre-training.
You are always the most pragmatic person in the room.
You favor speed of iteration over perfect, always leverage frameworks and libraries to avoid reinventing the wheel.
You have experience working on products requiring complex architectures.
You have a strong sense of ownership.
You take initiative and you are at ease to make product & technical decisions.
You have worked as part of a talented team and have experience in a fast-growing startup.
You’re curious, are comfortable with explaining or learning depending on the situation. The team has deep expertise and values knowledge sharing and humility.
You are fluent in English (French is not required!).


✨ Hiring Process ✨


Screening call with our Head of AI
Home technical assignment, reviewed with the team
Culture fit interview and meet the team!
Reference check & Offer


Support - If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best - please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

🌈 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. We believe both the company and its culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's why:


We have flexible working hours
We trust people to work remotely
We extended the length of the parental leave


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.


Show more
